title: Introduction to Data Science | 365 Data Science
description:
This video will begin by clarifying the similarities and differences between the terms: Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence, and Machine Learning.

Then, we’ll focus on helping you digest the definitions you need to know in an effective way.

By the end, you will be more than capable of being able to relate and apply varies expressions and buzzwords to the areas of data science they belong to! We hope this video helps you broaden your perspective. We’re also positive it will make the jumble of disciplines a little clearer and will assist you in choosing the best career path to enter the data science field!

This video is presented by 365 Data Science.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: This activity is available only in English.

title: Data Science Landscape
description:
In this course, you will understand the evolution and relevance of data science in the world today. You’ll also explore the scientific method for science projects, and the data science team key roles.

What you’ll learn 
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Understand what data science is
Explore the history and evolution of Data science
Understand the factors contributing to the growth of data science
Explore the domains involved in the field of data science
Understand the critical roles involved in data science projects

title: Python for Data Science
description:
This introduction to Python will kickstart your learning of Python for data science, as well as programming in general. This beginner-friendly Python course will take you from zero to programming in Python in a matter of hours. Upon its completion, you'll be able to write your own Python scripts. If you want to learn Python from scratch, this free course is for you.

Note on grading - please read:

Review questions are worth 50% of the mark, and the final exam is worth 50%. The course passing grade is 70%.
Review Questions:
Have no time limit. This should encourage participants to go back to material previously explained to find the correct answer.
Multiple choice questions have two chances while True/False questions only have one chance.
Review questions are marked per question. As soon as you answer a particular question, when the “Final check” button appears, it means you will have no more chances after clicking that button, and your answer will be immediately marked and cannot be changed (ever). You will be able to see your grade progress at any time using the “Progress” tab.
Final Exam:
Has a 1-hour time limit
Like Review Questions, as you click on “Final check” per question, you will be marked.

title: Data Analysis with Python
description: In this course you will learn about: Data Acquisition How to Obtain Basic Insight From a Dataset Data

title: Data Visualization with Python
description:
Data visualization is the graphical representation of data in order to interactively and efficiently convey insights to clients, customers, and stakeholders in general. It is a way to summarize your findings and display it in a form that facilitates interpretation and can help in identifying patterns or trends. In this course you will learn how to create interesting graphics and charts and customize them to make them more effective and more pleasing to your audience.

Note on grading - please read:

Review questions are worth 50% of the mark, and the final exam is worth 50%. The course passing grade is 70%.

title: Applied Data Science with Python
description:
Welcome to the Applied Data Science with Python learning plan!
You will learn how to code in Python for data science, then analyze and visualize data with Python with packages like scikit-learn, matplotlib, and bokeh.

: 3

Come along and start your learning plan of to receive a series of that culminate in earning the .

title: Data Science Methodology
description: Grab your lab coat, beakers, and pocket calculator ... wait what? Wrong path! Fast forward and get in line with emerging data science methodologies that are in use and are making waves or rather predicting and determining which wave is coming and which one has just passed.

title: Data Science 101
description:
The art of uncovering the insights and trends in data has been around since ancient times. The ancient Egyptians used census data to increase efficiency in tax collection and they accurately predicted the flooding of the Nile river every year. Since then, people working in data science have carved out a unique and distinct field for the work they do, this field is data science. In this course, we will meet some data science practitioners and we will get an overview of what data science is today.

title: R for Data Science
description: R is a powerful language for data analysis, data visualization, machine learning, statistics. Originally developed for statistical programming, it is now one of the most popular languages in data science. In this course, you'll be learning about the basics of R, and you'll end with the confidence to start writing your own R scripts.

title: What is Data Science?
description: What is Data Science? testestestestestestestestestest

title: Data Science Tools
description: Learn about the most popular data science tools, including how to use them and what their features are.

title: IBM Data Science Community
description:
Interested in how to pursue a data science career at IBM and learning and certification? Participate in discussions and share resources with other members of the data science community.

Note: This activity is currently available only in English.

title: Enterprise Data Science in Practice
description: This course content is intended to assist individuals with an active interest in gaining a better positioning in the job marketplace through the acquisition of skills in the field of Data Science.

title: Learn about a career in data science
description:
Data science is a rapidly-growing field with plenty of opportunities for curious minds. What industries focus most on data science, what technical skills might be in demand, and what interesting jobs are in this field? The answer to these questions, plus a few more facts, are included in the following infographic.

Also available in Spanish, French, and Brazilian Portuguese.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

title: Data Science in 5 Minutes | Data Science For Beginners | What Is Data Science? | Simplilearn
description:
Data Science is basically dealing with unstructured and structured data. Data Science is a field that comprises of everything that is related to data cleansing, preparation, and analysis. In simple terms, it is the umbrella of techniques used when trying to extract insights and information from data.

In this video, you will learn about:
The life of a Data Scientist
Steps in Data Science project
Understanding the business problem
Data acquisition
Data preparation
Exploratory data analysis
Data modeling
Visualization and communication
Deploy and maintenance
Roles offered to a Data Scientist
Salary of a Data Scientist
After you complete this activity, select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: On the video toolbar, go to Settings, select Subtitles, select English, and then select Auto-Translate to enable subtitles in a language of your choice from the drop-down.

title: Introduction to the Tools and Techniques of Data Science
description:
Data science is a term that seems to be everywhere nowadays and there is a lot of conflicting advice of how to enter the field. This course presents the key concepts behind the terms data science and provides the learner with the the knowledge to use open source tools and resources in order to help them get started in their journey to data science.  During the course the learner will learn about tools like Python, Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Docker as well as to various open source data sources. The learner will also be exposed to the most fundamental techniques of data science,  AI and machine learning.
This course presents the key concepts and open source tools and resources in order to get started in your journey to data science.
This course requires you register for an IBMid to access.

title: Getting started with enterprise data science
description: Whether it is fighting fraud, detecting cancer, or predicting a hurricane, you need data and AI. Join a new wave of data-savvy professionals with access to millions of jobs available in the market.

title: Machine Learning for Data Science Projects
description: This course content is intended to assist individuals with an active interest in gaining a better positioning in the job marketplace through the acquisition of skills in the field of Data Science.

title: Improving Healthcare: The Role of Data Analytics and Data Science
description: This course is intended to assist medical, nursing, pharmacy, public health, dental, health informatics, computation science, biomedical engineering, and allied health professionals working in and leading within healthcare to understand the role of data analytics and data science in healthcare and how it can help tackle real-world healthcare challenges.

title: Data Science vs Big Data vs Data Analytics | Simplilearn
description:
In this video, we will differentiate between the Data Science, Big Data, and Data Analytics, based on what it is, where it is used, the skills you need to become a professional in the field, and the salary prospects in each field.

This video is presented by Simplilearn.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: This activity is available only in English.

title: Getting Started Off-Platform for Data Science
description:
This course will introduce you to all of the tools you will need to get started off-platform as well as some helpful tricks for each technology. These are the most common technologies used by Data Professionals across sectors. This course will teach you how to do data science projects on your own computer locally. This course is presented by Codecademy. You will need to register for a free account. In this course, you will learn about:
Using the Command Line
Installing and using Jupyter Notebooks
Setting up and using PostgreSQL
Git workflow
Setting up and using integrated development environments

title: How to Become a Data Analyst in 2020 | 365 Data Science
description:
In this video, we’ll talk about becoming a data analyst in 2020! More specifically, we’ll look at who the data analyst is, what they do, how they fare in terms of salaries, and what skills and academic background you need to become one.

This video is presented by 365 Data Science.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: On the video toolbar, go to Settings, select Subtitles, select English, and then select Auto-Translate to enable subtitles in a language of your choice from the drop-down.

title: Data Science | IBM Cloud Learn Hub
description:
Data science combines the scientific method, math and statistics, specialized programming, advanced analytics, AI, and even storytelling to uncover and explain the business insights buried in data.

The IBM Cloud Learn Hub website provides education about cloud topics, technologies, and strategies. Explore and read about topics such as:
What is data science?
The data science lifecycle
Data science tools
Data science and cloud computing
Data science use cases
Data science and IBM Cloud
After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: This activity is available only in English.

title: What is Data Science? - Advice for New Data Scientists by IBM #3
description:
This 3-minute video is part of an online course, What is Data Science?, created by IBM. This video addresses skills and qualities needed by data scientists.

Note: This activity is currently available only in English.

title: Data Science in Our World
description:
In this course, you will learn about the field of data science, including widely adopted methodologies, an example project as it moves through the steps of a data science methodology, the application of data science in our world, and the role of data scientists and their colleagues.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Define data science
Recognize the importance of being curious to solve problems with data
Differentiate between the fields of data analytics and data science
Identify three widely adopted data science methodologies
Explore a data project scenario and identify key tasks as it moves through a methodology
Recognize industries and applications of data science that help solve problems and discover innovations
Compare the roles and characteristics of a data analyst, data scientist, and data engineer

title: What is data science?
description:
Learn why data science is like hunting for treasure! You'll get a closer look at the work and why you might choose it as your own career.
Duration: Complete the activities in this course and earn 30 minutes of learning credit!

title: Data Science in the Real World
description:
Explore what it's like to be a data scientist. From an overview of job opportunities to interviews with people currently working in data analysis, you'll get a feel for this exciting career.

Duration: Complete the activities in this course and earn 20 minutes of learning credit!

title: Big Data In 5 Minutes | What Is Big Data? | Introduction To Big Data | Big Data Explained | Simplilearn
description:
Massive amount of data that cannot be stored, processed, and analyzed using the traditional ways is known as Big Data. Hadoop is a framework that manages Big Data storage in a distributed way and processes it parallelly. This video will help you understand:
What is Big Data?
The 5V's of Big Data
Why Hadoop came into existence
What is Hadoop?
You will also learn about the storage unit and processing unit of Hadoop, and the implementation of Big Data through use cases.

This video is presented by Simplilearn.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: On the video toolbar, go to Settings, select Subtitles, select English, and then select Auto-Translate to enable subtitles in a language of your choice from the drop-down.

title: Algorithms | Khan Academy
description:
This is the Algorithms unit from an online, self-paced review course for Computer Science Principles. This unit gives an overview of algorithms: expressing algorithms in flow chart and pseudocode, testing their correctness, and measuring their efficiency. It also explores heuristics-based approaches for problems that can’t be solved in a reasonable amount of time, introduces the existence of undecidable problems, and explains the computational methods of parallel and distributed computing.

You will find short instructional content offerings, videos, and sample quiz questions to practice what you've learned and "level up" on your skills.

Note: It is designed to prepare for a U.S. college examination, however the computer science content is valuable more broadly.

The topics include:
Building algorithms
Evaluating algorithms
Solving hard problems
Parallel and distributed computing

The content is offered in English.

This learning activity is presented by Khan Academy.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

description: Learn more about data analytics concepts, methodologies and applications of data science, and the tools and programming languages used in the data ecosystem. You will acquire a conceptual understanding of how to clean, refine, and visualize data using IBM Watson Studio.

title: Online data security | Khan Academy
description:
This is the Online data security unit from an online, self-paced review course for Computer Science Principles. This unit introduces the concept of PII and the ways in which PII and other data can be tracked online (cookies, search history, browsing history, geolocation). Learn how attackers can gain access to data and devices with phishing, rogue access points, and malware, and see how you can protect yourself with encryption, secure protocols, strong passwords, and multifactor authentication.

You will find short instructional content offerings, videos, and sample quiz questions to practice what you've learned and "level up" on your skills.

Note: It is designed to prepare for a U.S. college examination, however the computer science content is valuable more broadly.

The topics include:
Introduction to online data security
PII (Personally identifiable information)
User data tracking
Cyber attacks
Data encryption techniques
Secure Internet protocols
User authentication methods

The content is offered in English.

This learning activity is presented by Khan Academy.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

title: Digital information | Khan Academy
description:
This is the Digital information unit from an online, self-paced review course for Computer Science Principles. This unit explains how computers store information digitally, as binary data. Learn about the binary number system, the conversion of analog to digital data, and data compression strategies.

You will find short instructional content offerings, videos, and sample quiz questions to practice what you've learned and "level up" on your skills.

Note: It is designed to prepare for a U.S. college examination, however the computer science content is valuable more broadly.

The topics include:
Bits and bytes
Binary numbers
Limitations of storing numbers
Storing text in binary
Converting analog data to binary
Lossless data compression
Lossy data compression
Digital copyright and licenses

The content is offered in English.

This learning activity is presented by Khan Academy.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

title: Introduction to Data Concepts
description:
In this course, you will become familiar with fundamental data concepts such as types of data, big data, the typical steps in the data analytics process, and data visualization.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Explain the importance of data in a digital world
Differentiate between unstructured and structured data
Identify the purpose of a database
Differentiate between quantitative and qualitative data
Describe the five V’s of big data
Describe the four types of data analytics
Explain the work involved in each step of the data analysis process
Identify the purpose of a data visualization
Recognize different charts to display data visualizations in the best way

title: Overview of Data Tools and Languages
description:
In this course, you will get an introduction to common data analysis and visualization tools so you’re familiar with them and can recognize how data science projects use them.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Recognize the value of collaborating and using open source in the field of data science
Identify the purpose of GitHub
Identify the purpose of a selection of common tools to analyze and visualize data, including:
Microsoft Excel
Google Sheets
Structured Query Language (SQL)
Python
IBM Watson Studio
Tableau
Matplotlib
Identify factors businesses can consider when selecting a data transformation tool
Identify factors individuals can consider when selecting a data transformation tool

title: Clean, Refine, and Visualize Data with IBM Watson Studio
description:
In this course, you will practice cleaning, refining, and visualizing data, in a series of simulations, using IBM Watson Studio with the data refinery tool.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Explain the purpose and key features of IBM Watson Studio
Set up a new project in IBM Watson Studio
Import a data set
Clean data using the data refinery tool
Refine data using the data refinery tool
Create a data visualization
Conclude insights from a data visualization

title: Your Future in Data: The Job Landscape
description:
In this course, you will learn about the data job market and projections, the responsibilities and skill sets of a data analyst and data scientist, and resources and learning opportunities so you can explore more.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Recognize the global demand for data analysts and data scientists in the job market
Recognize the future of the field of data analytics
Identify industries in which data professionals work
Identify the primary responsibilities of a data analyst and data scientist
Identify the skills that data professionals need
Identify the tools to know when starting out in the field
Identify resources to learn more and stay up to date in the field of data science

title: Data Fundamentals (Earn a credential!)
description:
Do you love to discover meaning in facts and numbers? Learn the concepts and methods of data science and how its discoveries change the world. Then get hands-on practice cleaning, refining, and visualizing data, in a series of simulations, using IBM Watson Studio with the data refinery tool. Finish by gathering tips and resources that can help you launch a great career in data science. 
  
Complete the following required courses to earn an industry-recognized IBM SkillsBuild digital credential called :

title: What does a data analyst actually do? | Silicon Republic
description:
Dave Elkington, CEO of InsideSales.com, explains the role of data analysts, and why cleaning up data sets takes up the vast majority of their time. Then, algorithms and computer science play a minor role.

This video is presented by Silicon Republic.

title: IBM Cloud Pak for Data 5.0: Technical Essentials
description:
This course provides an overview of the IBM Cloud Pak for Data platform, its deployment options, services, exemplary business scenarios, and the architecture. You learn how the Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform relates to IBM Cloud Pak for Data. You review the core Kubernetes glossary and basic concepts of containerization and microservices. The course also introduces basic concepts of data science project workflow and data cycle.
This course provides an overview of the IBM Cloud Pak for Data platform, its deployment options, services, exemplary business scenarios, and the architecture.
This course requires you register for an IBMid to access.

title: Data analysis | Khan Academy
description:
This is the Data analysis unit from an online, self-paced review course for Computer Science Principles. The unit introduces data analysis and the world of big data. Learn about storing data sets in files, spreadsheets, and databases, computing statistics like average and maximum, finding patterns like trends and correlations. Learn how big data can be used to improve algorithms like translation, image recognition, and recommendations.

You will find short instructional content offerings, videos, and sample quiz questions to practice what you've learned and "level up" on your skills.

Note: It is designed to prepare for a U.S. college examination, however the computer science content is valuable more broadly.

The topics include:
Data tools
Big data
Bias in machine learning

The content is offered in English.

title: Python for Machine Learning: Unlocking the Power of Artificial Intelligence
description:
Are you fascinated by the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) and eager to explore its applications in the real world? "Python for Machine Learning: Unlocking the Power of Artificial Intelligence" is a dynamic course that takes you on a captivating journey through the history, concepts, and practical applications of AI.

Using Python as your tool of choice, you'll gain hands-on experience in harnessing the power of AI to make predictions, comprehend language and images, and replicate human brain-inspired circuits. By the end of this course, you'll have the necessary skills and insights to build and test your own machine learning models, as well as invaluable guidance on forging a career in the exciting field of artificial intelligence.


1. Python for Data Science 
2. Machine Learning with Python


The knowledge and skills in these courses build on each other, so SkillsBuild recommends that you complete the courses in the order in which they are presented.

 English
 
Select  to enroll in this learning plan and get started!

title: Comprendre le Big Data à travers les films de cinéma | OpenClassrooms
description:
Le Big Data, tout le monde en parle et pourtant, nous ne réalisons pas à quel point ces nouvelles technologies nous touchent tous les jours. Sans que nous y ayons pris garde, nos vies sont devenues de plus en plus « digitales » et génèrent un flot ininterrompu de données. Ce déluge de données serait-il en train de révolutionner notre façon d’expérimenter et de comprendre le monde, voire... De le prédire ?
Qu’est-ce que le Big Data ? Peut-on prévoir le monde avec Big Data ? Pourquoi dit-on que le monde devient algorithmique ? Y a-t-il un risque de dérive pour notre vie privée ? C’est ce que vous allez découvrir dans ce cours ludique, à travers de nombreux exemples réels qui semblent pourtant tout droit sortis de films de science-fiction !

title: Your Future in Data: The Job Landscape
description:
In this course, you will learn about the data job market and projections, the responsibilities and skill sets of a data analyst and data scientist, and resources and learning opportunities so you can explore more.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Recognize the global demand for data analysts and data scientists in the job market
Recognize the future of the field of data analytics
Identify industries in which data professionals work
Identify the primary responsibilities of a data analyst and data scientist
Identify the skills that data professionals need
Identify the tools to know when starting out in the field
Identify resources to learn more and stay up to date in the field of data science

title: The Art of Data Visualization | Off Book | PBS Digital Studios
description:
Humans have a powerful capacity to process visual information, skills that date far back in our evolutionary lineage. And since the advent of science, we have employed intricate visual strategies to communicate data, often utilizing design principles that draw on these basic cognitive skills. In a modern world where we have far more data than we can process, the practice of data visualization has gained even more importance. From scientific visualization to pop infographics, designers are increasingly tasked with incorporating data into the media experience. Data has emerged as such a critical part of modern life that it has entered into the realm of art, where data-driven visual experiences challenge viewers to find personal meaning from a sea of information, a task that is increasingly present in every aspect of our information-infused lives.

Data analysts use visualizations like charts, graphs, and maps to help people understand the data’s meaning. Done right, these data visualizations bring clarity and simplicity to complicated issues.

This video is presented by PBS Digital Studios.

After you complete this activity, return to this page to select Mark complete for completion credit.

Note: On the video toolbar, go to Settings, select Subtitles, select English, and then select Auto-Translate to enable subtitles in a language of your choice from the drop-down.

title: Datová analýza a datová věda
description: Data jsou všude kolem nás a jsou nezbytnou součástí našich životů. V této sekci najdeš kurzy, které se zabývají jak datovou analýzou, tak oblastí data science (neboli datovou vědou). Díky tomu zjistíš, proč je analýza dat důležitá, získáš povědomí o tom, jaké existují typy databází, seznámíš se s prací datového analytika nebo se rovnou naučíš pracovat s daty s pomocí Pythonu.

title: Le machine learning est-il l'avenir de l'homme ? | OpenClassrooms
description:
Il y a quelques décennies, la notion d’Intelligence Artificielle appartenait à l’univers de la science-fiction. Aujourd’hui, nous entendons parler de Big Data, de Machine Learning, de Deep Learning, de robots pouvant exécuter des tâches autrefois dévolues aux humains. C’est sans aucun doute l’aspect le plus spectaculaire de la transformation digitale. Le nouvel épisode de ce cours présente des applications concrètes créées par ces technologies, au service d’usages marketing, culturels ou encore de gestion des agendas.

Ce MOOC est proposé par OpenClassrooms.
 
Après avoir suivi cette activité, revenez sur cette page et sélectionnez " Marquer terminé" afin de prendre en compte ce parcours.

Note : cette activité est uniquement disponible en français.

title: Techniques to Manage, Share, and Put Data to Work
description:
Dive into applications of data science and machine learning. You'll see how programming languages like R and Python and visualization tools like Tableau and ggplot2 can help uncover data's deepest secrets.

Duration: Complete the activities in this course and earn 25 minutes of learning credit!

title: Climate, Biodiversity, and Human Society (brought to you by AXA Climate School)
description:
Sustainability science is rooted in the familiar concepts of conservation and ecology. Like those concepts, it explores the balance by which Earth’s resources and living things exist together. But its reach is greater. In these five courses, you’ll learn how sustainability also investigates human social groups, corporate operations and manufacturing, and even ways that buildings and bridges interact with weather and geology. Sustainability's goal? To improve human life while preserving the balance of nature.

Content for the activities Preamble, The Great Climate System, The Collapse of Biodiversity, The Overexploitation of Natural Resources, and Impacts on Human Societies are provided by AXA Climate School.

This course is available in the following languages:
In spoken: English, French, German
In subtitles: Spanish, Italian, Polish, Portuguese, simplified Chinese

title: Beyond Conservation to Sustainability
description:
Conservation—the preservation of Earth’s ecology and mineral wealth—will always be important. But sustainability takes a broader focus, using data analytics and advanced technology to consider how ecology works together with fields such as engineering, medicine, and the social sciences as a complex whole. 

What you’ll learn 
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Identify differences between conservation and sustainability
Define the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues that help guide sustainability
Select appropriate ways that businesses can apply ESG initiatives
Describe key sustainability business initiatives
Identify how advanced technologies can promote sustainability
Practice sustainability in your own life
 Untuk kursus dalam Bahasa, sikahkan menuju tautan berikut ini

title: Make an Impact with Data Analytics
description:
Data analytics can organize facts to reveal information about sustainability issues. With this information, organizations can predict climate risk and environmental problems, prevent disasters, solve mysteries of food production, and even help reduce deforestation.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Define data analytics
Describe several sustainability applications of data analytics
Explain how data analytics can help the food industry and its surrounding ecosystem
Explain how data analytics can assist organizations to manage their sustainability data to reduce energy usage and implement renewable energy
Describe ways that companies define and use environment, social, and governance (ESG) data
Apply data analytics to a sustainability problem

title: Make an Impact with AI
description:
With its ability to rapidly uncover information and make predictions using massive amounts of data, AI is revolutionizing ways that organizations can implement sustainability solutions. Its capabilities range from predicting energy demands and monitoring bridge safety to protecting the oceans and the world’s food supply. 

What you’ll learn 
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Define AI
Describe several types of AI
Describe several sustainability applications of AI
Explain how AI can see and analyze the unseen
Explain how AI can help businesses address sustainability goals and climate risk
Identify with the personal experience of working on an AI sustainability project
Apply AI to a sustainability problem
 Untuk kursus dalam Bahasa, sikahkan menuju tautan berikut ini

title: Make an Impact with Hybrid Cloud
description:
Hybrid cloud securely combines private and public storage of vast data libraries, simultaneously helping organizations control their data costs while reducing their IT’s carbon emissions.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Describe key differences between private, public, and hybrid cloud computing
Select software development issues that hybrid cloud can address
Identify ways that hybrid cloud can promote green computing
Organize the steps of a green IT implementation
Describe key sustainability applications of hybrid cloud

title: Make an Impact with Future Technology
description:
Advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence and quantum computing are taking their place among the tools that organizations use to tackle sustainability problems. These technologies will enable solutions, previously thought impossible to discover and implement.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Describe the future of sustainability
Identify new or rapidly changing technologies that can impact sustainability issues
Select technologies that might be applied to difficult sustainability problems

title: Fundamentals of Sustainability and Technology (Earn a credential!)
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to build skills for jobs in the green economy and contribute to a more sustainable future? The world increasingly recognizes the need for environmentally friendly practices in all areas of life, and this learning plan can help you acquire the skills and knowledge needed to make a meaningful impact. 
 
By enrolling in this learning plan, you’ll have the chance to learn about sustainability science and its applications in various fields of technology. Not only will you gain knowledge about sustainability, but you’ll also develop practical skills to make a difference in various industries such as renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, green building, and waste management. You’ll learn to define sustainability, identify ways that sustainability updates and extends the concept of conservation, and describe key applications of artificial intelligence and data analytics to drive sustainability. 
  
By completing these courses, you’ll earn an industry recognized SkillsBuild credential in . This credential can help you stand out to potential employers and demonstrate your commitment to sustainability. 
  
After completing the courses required for the credential, you should be able to:

sub_courses.title: Earn it! Accept it! Share it! | IBM SkillsBuild
Climate, Biodiversity, and Human Society (brought to you by AXA Climate School)
Beyond Conservation to Sustainability
Make an Impact with Data Analytics
Make an Impact with AI
Make an Impact with Hybrid Cloud
Make an Impact with Future Technology

title: Change the World with Sustainability Science
description:
Sustainability science uses advanced data analytics to measure and manage environmental and social issues. In this course, you’ll look at how emerging technologies are now making it possible to assess more accurately, and address, challenges that impact our world, both at the local and at the global level. 
 
What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Define sustainability and sustainability science
Explain why sustainability requires big data analysis driven by advanced information technology
Explain how data analysis enables organizations to measure sustainability through ESG (environmental, social, and governance) data
Define ESG frameworks and their importance
Describe how IBM Envizi ESG Suite enables analysis of sustainability issues
Apply basic sustainability analysis to real-world situations

title: Your Future in Sustainability
description:
Data analysis offers a multitude of rewarding career paths. In this course, you’ll reflect on the types of careers and technical specializations in sustainability that interest you. You’ll also examine how you can apply your passion and expertise to build a career in sustainability science.

What you’ll learn
After completing this course, you should be able to:
Explore the relationship between sustainability efforts and technology
Discover major fields whose study can be applied to sustainability issues
Identify the disciplines that underlie each major field
Define an opportunity for a career path into sustainability science

title: R 101
description: Are you ready to dive head-first into R? In just a few hours you'll learn how to write your own R code, learn about R's data structures and create your own functions. You’ll even be able to import data and do some operations. Try our hands-on exercises as we guide your first steps into your data science journey with R.

title: AI Enterprise Workflow: End-to-End Creation and Deployment of Machine Learning Models
description:
The IBM AI Enterprise Workflow is a comprehensive, end-to-end process that trains data scientists to build AI solutions, starting with business priorities and working through to taking AI into production. This short course serves as an introduction to key concepts in the AI Enterprise Workflow. Learners will consider key data science and AI principles with a focus on business applications.
This short course serves as an introduction to key concepts in the AI Enterprise Workflow.
This course requires you register for an IBMid to access.

title: Watson Studio Primer
description:
This course is a quick getting started guide to Watson Studio for Data Scientists ranging from a student to professional level. This course will enable learners to be up and running on Watson Studio, using notebooks hosted on IBM cloud to work with their data, no matter where it lives.  Learners will take away how to work in a collaborative, cloud-based notebook environment using Watson Studio. Learners will see how Watson Studio supports a Data Scientist through the different stages of the Data Science project life-cycle.
This course is a quick getting started guide to Watson Studio for Data Scientists ranging from a student to professional level.
This course requires you register for an IBMid to access.

title: Improving Healthcare: The Role of Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description: This course is intended to assist medical, nursing, pharmacy, public health, dental, health informatics, computation science, biomedical engineering, and allied health professionals working in and leading within healthcare to understand the role of data and AI in healthcare and how it can help tackle real-world healthcare challenges.
